revised_title: Detecting Chaos in Noisy Time Series: A New Methodology
tldr: The authors propose a new method for detecting low-dimensional chaotic time series in the presence of dynamical noise. The method identifies the sign of the largest Liapunov exponent, indicating the presence or absence of chaos and the possibility of assigning a value to the exponent. This approach can work for short time series of only 500 points and is demonstrated using real and model systems, including chickenpox and measles data from New York City.
